clinical_study.brief_title: Study on the Effect of Bile Reflux on Gastric Cancer and Its Precancerous Lesions: a Cross-sectional Study.
clinical_study.official_title: Study on the Effect of Bile Reflux on Gastric Cancer and Its Precancerous Lesions: a Multiple Center, Cross-sectional Study.

brief_summary.textblock: To explore the effects of bile reflux on gastric cancer and its precancerous lesions, so as to better prevent the occurrence and development of gastric cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: This study was a multicenter cross-sectional study. Patients were consecutively enrolled and divided into gastric cancer group, gastric precancerous lesions group, and chronic gastritis group, according to histopathological results. The bile reflux detection rate and Helicobacter pylori infection status were recorded for each group.

primary_outcome.measure: corelation between the bile reflux and gastric mucosa diseases
primary_outcome.description: we evaluate the corelation between the bile reflux and gastric mucosa diseases according to the histopathological results and the scales the patients finished

secondary_outcome.measure: the risk factors of primary bile reflux gastritis
secondary_outcome.description: we evaluate the the risk factors of primary bile reflux gastritis according to the scales and endoscopical results

arm_group.description: patients with chronic non-atrophic gastritis and chronic atrophic gastritis according to histopathological results
patients with gastric intestinal metaplasia and intraepithelial neoplasia according to histopathological results
patients with gastric cancer according to histopathological results

study_pop.textblock: patients are from several centers all around the China

clinical_study.keyword: gastric cancer; helicobacter pylori; precancerous lesion; bile reflux
